document.docAuthor: Chаtterjee, Tаpаs, Dovgаl, Igor, Pešić, Vlаdimir & Zаwаl, Аndrzej
document.masterDocTitle: A checklist of epibiont suctorian and peritrich ciliates (Ciliophora) on halacarid and hydrachnid mites (Acari: Halacaridae & Hydrachnidia)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A checklist of epibiont suctorian and peritrich ciliates (Ciliophora) on halacarid and hydrachnid mites (Acari: Halacaridae & Hydrachnidia)

bibRefCitation.refString: Kahl, A. (1935) Urtiere oder Protozoa. I: Wimpertiere oder Ciliata (Infusoria), eine Bearbeitung der freilebenden und ectocommensalen Infusorien der Erde, unter Ausschuss der marinen Tintinnidae. In: Dahl, F. (Ed.), Die Tierwelt Deuchland, Pt. 30, pp. 651 - 886.

subSubSection.paragraph: Records on hydrachnid mites : Kahl (1935) described the species, which found on legs of freshwater aquatic mites (without host identification) from Germany.

New finds : In the present paper we report the following new records of
Opercularia minima
:

Locality: Valley of Krąpiel river near Dalewo, Poland (53°23'01.1"N, 15°10'18.3"E); biotope: oxbow, 0.5 m depth,
Glyceria
sp.undergrowth; host species:
Arrenurus bicuspidator Berlese, 1885
; localization: legs; Intensity: 1 ciliate per host individual. Date of collection 15.10.2010 , collector: А. Zawal.

Locality: Valley of Krąpiel river near Dalewo, Poland (53°23'01.1"N, 15°10'18.3"E); biotope: oxbow, 0.5 m depth,
Glyceria
sp.undergrowth; host species:
Arrenurus cuspidator (Müller, 1776)
; localization: legs; Intensity: 5 ciliates per host individual. Date of collection 15.10.2010 , collector: А. Zawal.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Locality: Somiko Lake, Poland (54°04'45.0"N, 17°52'47.2"E); biotope: 1 m depth,

sp. under growth; Host species:

; localization: legs; intensity: 2ciliates per host individual. Date of collection 31.07.2014 , collector: А. Zawal.

subSubSection.paragraph:
This species was also reported by
Safi et al . (2014)
at artificial substrates (glass slides) deployed in Guaiba Lake in Brasilia, Brazil.
